episodes.synopsis: There's a flip side to everything, the saying goes, and in two minutes, Derek Sivers shows this is true in a few ways you might not expect.
episodes.title: Derek Sivers: Weird, or Just Different?

episodes.synopsis: Why do people see the Virgin Mary on a cheese sandwich? Michael Shermer, a skeptic, shows how we convince ourselves to believe and overlook the facts.
episodes.title: Michael Shermer on Strange Beliefs

episodes.synopsis: What was the greatest invention of the industrial revolution? Hans Rosling makes the case for the washing machine -- the magic of electricity!
episodes.title: Hans Rosling and the Magic Washing Machine

episodes.synopsis: Christien Meindertsma examines the afterlife of an ordinary pig and how its parts end up in many non-pork products from bullets to artificial hearts.
episodes.title: Christien Meindertsma: How Pig Parts Make the World Turn

episodes.synopsis: Dan Cobley uses Newton's second law, the scientific method and the second law of thermodynamics to explain the fundamental theories of branding.
episodes.title: Dan Cobley: What Physics Taught Me About Marketing

episodes.synopsis: Inventions change the world intentionally or unexpectedly. Edward Tenner describes our ability to innovate and inability to foresee the consequences.
episodes.title: Edward Tenner: Unexpected Consequences

episodes.synopsis: Homaro Cantu and Ben Roche are from Moto, a Chicago restaurant that plays with ways to cook and eat food. How can this technology be used for good?
episodes.title: Homaro Cantu and Ben Roche: Cooking as Alchemy

episodes.synopsis: What if every light bulb in the world could also transmit data? At TEDGlobal, Harald Haas demonstrates a device that could do exactly that.
episodes.title: Harald Haas: Wireless Data from Every Light Bulb

episodes.synopsis: After death, can we still commit our bodies to a greener Earth? Jae Rhim Lee has created a burial suit seeded with pollution-gobbling mushrooms.
episodes.title: Jae Rhim Lee: My Mushroom Burial Suit

episodes.synopsis: The rise of scientific understanding transformed the world within a few centuries. Why? Physicist David Deutsch proposes a subtle answer.
episodes.title: David Deutsch: A New Way to Explain Explanation

episodes.synopsis: Mycologist Paul Stamets lists ways the mycelium fungus is a savior: cleaning polluted soil, making insecticides, treating smallpox and even flu.
episodes.title: Paul Stamets on Six Ways Mushrooms Can Save the World

episodes.synopsis: Tipping Point author Malcolm Gladwell examines the food industry's pursuit of the perfect spaghetti sauce and speaks on the nature of choice.
episodes.title: Malcolm Gladwell on Spaghetti Sauce

episodes.synopsis: Joachim de Posada shares a landmark experiment on delayed gratification -- and how it can predict future success.
episodes.title: Joachim de Posada Says, 'Don't Eat the Marshmallow Yet'

video.title: TEDTalks: Inexplicable Connections
video.synopsis: A mushroom suit? Light bulbs that transmit data? Watch TED speakers make ingenious, unexpected solutions to some of the world's biggest problems.
